title: University Lecturer, Chemistry & Environmental Science
description:
**Title:**  

University Lecturer, Chemistry & Environmental Science

 **Department:**  

Chemistry and Environmental Science

 **Reports To:**  

Department Chair  

  

**Position Type:**  

Faculty  

  

**Position Summary:**  

New Jersey Institute of Technology has an opening for a University Lecturer - Chemistry in the Department of Chemistry and Environmental Science. The position will start in Fall 2024, with responsibilities beginning in late August. The University Lecturer - Chemistry position is a 10-month full-time non-tenure-track faculty position where the chief responsibility is teaching. The successful candidate will have capabilities in teaching general chemistry and one or more of the following: Organic and/or Physical Chemistry lecture and laboratory.  

  

**Essential Functions:**  

* Teaching multiple sections of first-year chemistry courses.
* Teaching sections of Organic and/or Physical Chemistry.
* Teaching laboratory sections in areas such as Organic and/or Physical Chemistry.
* Engaging in Department and University service on committees and workgroups.
* Developing teaching skills through formal and informal opportunities.
 **Prerequisite Qualifications:**  

* The ideal candidate will have a Ph.D. in chemistry or a related field and a minimum of two years of experience teaching college-level chemistry.
* The position also requires the ability to use one’s initiative as well as work well with others.
* At the university's discretion, the education and experience prerequisites may be exempted where the candidate can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the university, an equivalent combination of education and experience specifically preparing the candidate for success in the position.
 **Bargaining Unit:**  

PSA

 **FLSA:**  

Exempt  

Full-Time


  
* As an EEO employer NJIT is committed to building a diverse and inclusive teaching, research, and working environment and strongly encourages applications from individuals with disabilities, minorities, veterans, and women.
* As a Minority Serving Institution with designations as an Asian American and Native American Pacific Islander Serving Institution (AANAPSI) and Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI), NJIT is committed to embracing diversity, centering equity, and practicing inclusion with the goal of sustaining a culture of belonging. NJIT celebrates the diversity of our university community and recognize the cultural and personal contributions each member of the community brings to NJIT. We strive to cultivate a campus culture that promotes inclusive excellence among our faculty, staff, students, and external partners. Sustaining and building upon our diverse community is critical to NJIT’s continuing status as a premier research institution of higher education and a leading polytechnic university.
* Employment at NJIT is subject to the provisions of New Jersey First Act which mandates new employees, who are not NJ residents, to establish primary residence in New Jersey within one year of their appointment to certain positions. The law does not apply to any individual employed at NJIT on a temporary or per semester basis as a visiting or adjunct professor, teacher, lecturer, researcher or administrator. For more information on the act please click here.
* If special accommodations are needed in applying for a position, please visit the Department of Human Resources located in Fenster Hall, Room 500, University Heights, Newark, NJ 07102 or call (973) 596-3140. If you have questions, please email the Human Resources Department at hr@njit.edu.
* Information regarding NJIT campus security, personal safety, and fire safety including topics such as, disciplinary procedures, crime prevention, NJIT Police law enforcement authority, crime reporting policies, and crime statistics for the most recent three year period is available on the NJIT Department of Public Safety here.
* NJIT is an E-Verify employer and uses E-Verify to confirm work authorization of each new hire.

title: Construction Manager
description:
We are looking for an experienced Construction Manager to help lead our team on large construction projects. This is a great opportunity for a self-starter to join a team that's committed to providing exceptional service. The successful candidate will have at least five years of experience supervising sites with emphasis on construction and will have a working knowledge of project management practices and time and cost estimation.

The candidate that has experience in construction of buildings and/or facilities projects with primary focus on sidewalks, ramps and landmarks building features. The candidate will work with us on construction of a facility in metro New York area. Ability to travel to see production in steel plants in various states to monitor production on schedule and in compliance with requirements.

The job duties and experience will include the following: review shop drawings, steel details, coordination with other trades, constructability review, design changes, review structural design packages for cost, completeness, constructability, and compliance. experience in building structures with emphasis on steel structure, experience working for a general contractor overseeing vertical construction. project management, bid management, RFP, cost control, coordinate with client. manage scope, schedule, budget, quality, safety, and change management. Structural engineering experience required with emphasis on steel. Ability to perform QA/QC of construction processes. Proficiency in Microsoft office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams). Understanding of steel design softwares. Experience in Procore or other construction management software is preferred. Experience with Blue-Beam and or Adobe PDF Pro.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year
